src:
Območje Male opreme kupila Občina Izola
06 Nov 2019, 11:43 by STA

Nepremičnino Mala oprema iz Izole, ki so jo prodajali na današnji dražbi v okviru stečajnega postopka ajdovskega Primorja, je kupila Občina Izola. Občina je bila sicer predkupna upravičenka, za nepremičnino, katere izklicna cena je bila 380.000 evrov, pa bo morala plačati 660.000 evrov.



Malo opremo je na dražbi v okviru stečajnega postopka ajdovskega Primorja kupila Občina Izola za 660.000 evrov. Foto: Mirjana Cerin

AJDOVŠČINA > Varščino za današnjo dražbo so plačali štirje dražitelji. Najvišjo ponudbo, 510.000 evrov, je na dražbi dalo podjetje Gasspar naložbe iz Portoroža, ki je s predkupno upravičenko, občino, dražil do vrednosti 660.000 evrov, nato pa od nadaljnjega draženja odstopil.
Podžupan Občine Izola Vlado Marič je po dražbi povedal, da občina na tem območju načrtuje gradnjo kulturnega centra. Denar za začetek postopka bodo zagotovili v občinskem proračunu prihodnje leto, gradnjo pa predvidoma začeli leta 2021.
"Lokacija tik ob morju je zanimiva, običajno bi jo drugi investitorji namenili za gradnjo apartmajev ali stanovanj. Mi pa imamo tam druge načrte in na tem območju ne bi želeli imeti kakšnih apartmajev," je povedal Marič.
Občina Izola je namreč že zdaj lastnica območja, ki se dotika danes kupljene nepremičnine, zato je želela uveljaviti lastništvo tudi na tem delu.
Nepremičnino so v okviru stečaja ajdovskega Primorja poskusili na dražbi prodati že nekajkrat, vendar doslej neuspešno.
Tokratna izklicna cena za 3351 kvadratnih metrov veliko pozidano stavbno zemljišče, ki se je že dražilo za več kot milijon evrov, je znašala le 380.000 evrov, a je zanj veljalo več omejitev. Že iz razpisa javne dražbe je bilo razvidno, da je nepremičnina na vplivnem območju izolskega starega mestnega jedra, ki je z odlokom razglašeno za urbanistični spomenik.
Poleg tega izolski občinski prostorski načrt, ki je v pripravi, predvideva ukinitev izvedbenega akta in pripravo novega občinskega podrobnega prostorskega načrta na tem območju.
text:
The area of Small Equipment was purchased by the Municipality of Izola
06 Nov 2019, 11:43 by STA

The small equipment from Izola, which was sold at today's auction in the context of bankruptcy proceedings in the coastal region of Ajdovščina, was purchased by the Municipality of Izola. The municipality was the pre-emptive beneficiary, and it will have to pay 660,000 euros for the real estate, whose starting price was 380,000 euros.



The Municipality of Izola purchased the small equipment for auction in the context of the bankruptcy proceedings in the coast of Primorje for € 660,000. Photo: Mirjana Cerin

AJDOVINA> Four bidders have paid bail for today's auction. The highest bid, € 510,000, was auctioned by Gasspar Investments from Portorož, which auctioned the municipality with a pre-paid beneficiary to the value of € 660,000 and then withdrew from further auctioning.
Izola Municipality Mayor Vlado Maric said after the auction that the municipality plans to build a cultural center in the area. They will provide the money for the commencement of the process in the municipal budget next year, and construction is expected to begin in 2021.
"The location right by the sea is interesting, usually other investors would devote it to the construction of apartments or apartments. But we have other plans there and we would not want to have any apartments in this area," said Maric.
The Municipality of Izola already owns the area that touches the property purchased today, so it wanted to assert ownership in this part as well.
Real estate has been auctioned for several times in the context of the bankruptcy of the Primorje-Gorski Kotar region, but has so far failed.
The starting price for the 3,351 square meter large building land, which was already being auctioned for more than one million euros, was only 380,000 euros, but was subject to several restrictions. Already from the invitation to tender it was evident that the property is in the area of influence of the old town center of Izola, which was proclaimed an urban monument by a decree.
In addition, the municipal plan for Izola under preparation envisages the abolition of the implementing act and the preparation of a new municipal detailed spatial plan in the area.
